sentences.sContent: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
sentences.sCn: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。

sentences.sContent: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
sentences.sCn: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住，或者说至少有误导性。

sentences.sContent: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
sentences.sCn: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

synos.tran: 可疑的；暧昧的；无把握的；半信半疑的

trans.tranCn: 可疑的；暧昧的；无把握的；半信半疑的
trans.tranOther: probably not honest, true, right etc
